meanings.definition: To speak or cry out loudly or vehemently.
meanings.sent1: The children vociferated with joy when they saw the ice cream truck.
meanings.sent2: The protesters vociferated their demands outside the government building.
meanings.sent3: The parrot vociferated loudly, mimicking the sounds of the busy market.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm vociferated its anger through booming thunder.
meanings.sent5: The coach vociferated instructions to the players during the intense match.

meanings.definition: To utter with a loud and vehement voice.
meanings.sent1: She vociferated her disagreement with the new school policy.
meanings.sent2: The singer vociferated the lyrics of the song with passion.
meanings.sent3: The toddler vociferated his refusal to eat vegetables at dinner.
meanings.sent4: The wind vociferated through the trees, creating a haunting melody.
meanings.sent5: The teacher vociferated the answer to the math problem for the whole class to hear.
